CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1946, pg. 12, in "Public Opinion" Column, with question: "Do you feel that the city administration has been fair regarding the appointment of Negro fire captains in Hill District?" Cutline of image reads: "John W. Ashmon, 752 Anaheim Street, businessman: "If you simply must know the truth, I don't feel that they have been fair about the appointment of anyone or anything at any time.  We simply don't have enough.  That's all I have to say about the Fire Department deal."
TitMainTitle: Cobbler John Warren Ashmon, posed behind counter in his Champion Shoe Repair shop, 2935 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
